page.title: 08Interview: a local resident
page.content: Lady Margaret Fortescue interview continued. Lady Margaret enjoyed school as she hadn't been to school until she was fifteen. She made alot of friends and thought school was fun. There were about 150 children in her Swiss school and about the same in her English one. The main subjects she was taught were: English, French, German, Maths, Geography, History, Literature and Spelling. Her favourite subjects were History and Literature and she hated German and Maths. She did three-quarters of an hour homework after tea every day. Her childhood was different in that everyone was more strict. Castle Hill was started to be built in 1729, and it was finished in 1740. It took eleven years to build, and was built by Hugh Fortescue.
